creator: jks@iname.com
text:
Apparently the BalancerMember takes many parameters, but they are not documented well at http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_proxy.html#balancermember

I spent a long time trying to figure out why my sticksessions were not working, when I finally found in an email in the archives that I needed a route parameter set in the  BalancerMember line.

Are you asking to draw more attention to the options, or to draw attention to "route" option specifically?

Currently: "...and can take any of the key value pairs available to ProxyPass directives."  (ProxyPass being a hyperlink)
creator: covener@gmail.com

text:
Well route specifically confused me. "The route is a value appended to session id." doesn't really explain what it is and why my stickysessions were not working w/o routes being set. I also gathered from reading emails in the archives that are are some other options available that are not listed in ProxyPass (but I could be wrong about that, I didn't look in the source code. )

I also just noticed a typo under ttl:

"that has not" should be "that has have not"
creator: jks@iname.com
rbowen@apache.org
text:
I'm not able to find the typo mentioned. Can you point me to a location where this typo exists? Did someone already fix it?

This bug is two years old and has seen no activity. If you could provide a patch, or a description of route that you'd like to see in here, that would be very helpful.

creator: jks@iname.com
text: It looks like the documentation has been much improved since I filed this bug.  That typo does not exist.  The mod_proxy_balancer documentation now clearly explains that the role of routes in stickysessions.  This bug can be closed.
